It seems to have an electrical plug too!  Beautiful box there, Frank,  
can=
't buy though, To do so, I would have to skip my house payment.
 
 
In a me=
ssage dated 5/18/2010 3:34:05 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
purplealiengirl=
@... writes:

 
 
 
They do hear, but as far I know, not through the =
 box---but--they do seem 
to indicate the box transmits something, maybe a =
 quantum signal--whatever 
that is. You don't even have to have to sound co=
ming  out to get good 
recordings, like connecting the recorder via the hea=
dphone  jack. 
 
 F-S


On Mon, May 17, 2010 at 6:33 PM, trilobitegal 
<_fl=
exicalymenemeeki@flexicalymefle_ (mailto:flexicalymenemeeki@...)=
 >  wrote:


 
 
 
Oh, I think I understand this now. You don't speak to th=
e box much,  right? 
So, they don't really have to hear you?

<purplealiengirl@pur> wrote:

c inside the  chamber picks up 
the

e box and  fed to the oputput jack 
and

> 
>  F-S

somethi=
ng, or

e been 
using
> > > mostly what I call  direct mode, or no echo chamber. Wh=
en I use an

>  > > foil chamber I seem to get more ET types, a=
nd that's what I used  to 
get
> > "we
> > > come from the 6th planet" year=
s  ago.

> > > A very large echo chamber can have  a dramatic effect, =
like 12 inches
> > > square, and 4 feet long.  I made one that size out of =
MDF board and 
lined
> > it
> >  > wiht aluminum foil, the voices were so d=
emonic sounding that I took  
it
> > > apart. Later I found that if somethi=
ng works, you tend  to get the
> > negative
> > > guys to try to scare you =
 away from it.
